resources.string: Get additional features and support the developer.
Under which circumstances this app monitors Bluetooth data.
Should the Bluetooth Low Energy data scanner prioritize performance or conserve energy?
Pause audio when removing the device from your ear.
Show other people\'s devices that are near you.
Start audio playback when device is worn.
Show fake data, i.e., simulate devices that don\’t exist.
Additional settings to help troubleshoot issues with the app.
The minimum signal quality that a device needs to have to be considered yours.
If Android does not automatically connect, we can ask it too. This will set the monitor mode setting to \'Always\'.
When should we try to connect to your device?
Don\'t delegate data filtering to the system, instead get all data and filter within the app.
Don\'t let the system group collected BLE data before forwarding it to us.
The address of your paired device. The app uses this to determine when it is connected to your phone.
The model of your main device. This helps the app recognize your device when it is not connected to your phone.
Wearing both pods is not required, wearing a single pod is sufficient to trigger reactions.
Show a popup when the device case is opened (experimental).
Show a popup when the device connects for the first time.
Automatic error reports are anonymous. Share your install ID if the developer needs to find your error reports.
A public issue tracker for bug reports and feature requests (english only).
A place to hang out in and ask questions.
General tweaks that affect the whole app.
Automatically reports issues, e.g. details on an app crash so I can figure out how to fix it.
Show additional information to troubleshoot issues.
Remove any filters from the BLE scanner to show all broadcasted BLE data. Useful to add support for new headphone types.
Disable optimizations to improve compatibility. Try this if you are not seeing any data.
Help translate this app into your favorite language.
A widget showing the last known device status.
Use an alternative method to receive BLE data from the system (broadcast instead of callback).

AirPods (and similar headphones) broadcast status information using a BLE technology called \"advertisements\". Some phones don\'t implement this technology correctly. CAPod can attempt to fix this by trying different compatibility options until data is received. Start music playback on your headphones and place them close to your phone, then start the process.
BLE advertisement broadcasts are being received by CAPod.
Troubleshooting failed. No combination of compatibility options helped.

Your phone didn\'t receive any BLE data at all. You can retry this test in a crowded area to see if data sources (other than your headphones) can be received. No data being received points towards an issue with your phone\'s operating system.
Your phone received BLE data, but the data does not come from any supported device. Are your headphones powered on? Does CAPod support your headphone?
This app adds support for AirPod specific features to Android.
Not all Android devices fully support the extra AirPod features. Your operating system requires a correctly working Bluetooth-Low-Energy implemtation.
CAPod has no ads and does not collect your data.
You can upgrade to CAPod Pro to gain extra features and support development.
